title: Abusing HOF rankings in limited circumstances

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
HI,

I think you will close this as NA but i think you should resolve this bug at some point. 


As we know submitting duplicate report of valid report earns you +2 point and also gives you HOF(known bug).

So you will appear in team's HOF as https://hackerone.com/security/thanks with 2 points

Now how this can be abused  further to enhance your reputation points which will ultimately yields you higher ranking in HOF

So if you have points in HOF with points
 _Greater than 0 and less than 5_

here how we can abuse it further
Pre-Requistes
1.you are in HOF of some team with points greater than 0 and less than 5

Steps
1. submit a valid report
2.team closes the report as NA. at this point your main reputations will go -5. but in HOF it will become 0 as it cant go in negatives.
3.you send more info
4.Team reopens the bug.
5. now in HOF, instead of restoring your old points(which is less than 5), it will give +5 point
6. So even if they close the report to informative later, you got +5 points without resolving any of your report!
vulnerability_information_html:
HI,

I think you will close this as NA but i think you should resolve this bug at some point.

As we know submitting duplicate report of valid report earns you +2 point and also gives you HOF(known bug).

So you will appear in team's HOF as https://hackerone.com/security/thanks with 2 points

Now how this can be abused further to enhance your reputation points which will ultimately yields you higher ranking in HOF

So if you have points in HOF with points
Greater than 0 and less than 5

here how we can abuse it further
Pre-Requistes
1.you are in HOF of some team with points greater than 0 and less than 5

Steps

  1. submit a valid report 2.team closes the report as NA. at this point your main reputations will go -5. but in HOF it will become 0 as it cant go in negatives. 3.you send more info 4.Team reopens the bug.
  2. now in HOF, instead of restoring your old points(which is less than 5), it will give +5 point
  3. So even if they close the report to informative later, you got +5 points without resolving any of your report!

activities.message:
Hello @ashish_goanhacker,

Thanks for the report! We're just investigating this report and considering the best course of action.

Thank you for your patience! 


Evan
activities.markdown_message:
Hello @ashish_goanhacker,

Thanks for the report! We're just investigating this report and considering the best course of action.

Thank you for your patience!

Evan

activities.message:
Thanks @ashish_goanhacker again for the report. We've discussed this internally and concluded this report doesn't warrant an immediate fix as it doesn't have any security implications and it's dependant on a team's odd behavior. Because it's a nice find but without security implications we're closing this as Informative.

Keep on hacking,
Jens

activities.message: informative is better status for this report. i was expecting NA although it was tricky find. you all should start distributing swags for such bugs now :P
activities.markdown_message: informative is better status for this report. i was expecting NA although it was tricky find. you all should start distributing swags for such bugs now :P

activities.message: recently i have seen that , closing reports as informative reduces signal reputations. is it intentional or a another bug?
activities.markdown_message: recently i have seen that , closing reports as informative reduces signal reputations. is it intentional or a another bug?

activities.message: Do you mind public disclosure of this?
activities.markdown_message: Do you mind public disclosure of this?

activities.message:
Hey @ashish_goanhacker,

Sorry about the delay getting back to you!

To answer your earlier question, Signal is (more or less) an average of the reputation you gain or lose each time a report is closed. Because of this when a report is closed as 'Informative', you have one more data point with a value of 0 (the reputation granted for 'Informative' bugs), so if your reputation is above 0 your Signal will decrease a little, whereas if your Signal is less than zero it'll increase instead. Does that make sense?

As for publicly disclosing, seems fine to me. Even though this isn't a security concern it's definitely an interesting little quirk of how our reputation scores are calculated!

Thanks!

Evan
